subject: Automobile Racing
Hurricanes and Tropical Storms
organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: The approach of Tropical Storm Hanna forced Nascar officials to postpone Saturday night’s Sprint Cup Series race at Richmond (Va.) International Raceway. The Chevrolet 400 was moved to 1 p.m. Sunday. The race will finalize the field of 12 drivers who will be eligible to compete for the 2008 championship. The Nationwide Series race scheduled for Friday night was moved to Sunday at 7 p.m. Nascar said the field for both races will be set based on driver’s standings.
